videos.title: You Cannot Engineer an Audience to Gasp
videos.description:

videos.title: Adam Savage's Miniature Vault Door Build! (Part 4)
videos.description:
Time for a long-awaited update to Adam's 1/12 scale miniature vault build! With the main architectural framework completed, Adam turns to the gearing mechanism for operating the door lock. We've seen  his build of the miniature spur gears that line the interior circumfrence of the door, but today he machines the accompanying 12 racks that will push the pins to secure the door!

videos.title: Adam Savage Assembles a Working 3D-Printed Mechanical Counter!
videos.description:
Let's wrap this week up with a fun 3D-printer project: the assembly of working mechanical segment counter. Adam is blown away by the design and elegance of this analog mechanical device, complete with printed countersunk screws and support-free parts. It's a testament to quality and tolerance of 3D printed parts you can get from modern machines as well as the ingenuity and generosity of designers who share their work for the community to print!

3D files for this print: https://www.printables.com/model/860058-7-segment-mechanical-counter-version-2-ratchet
Assembly tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q5hJP_6xUcU
Printed on BambuLab X1C: https://www.matterhackers.com/store/l/bambu-lab-x1-carbon-combo-3d-printer/sk/M80GDCL5?aff=7553

Shot by Adam Savage and edited by Norman Chan

videos.title: Adam Savage Builds a Paperclip "Borromean Box" with @standupmaths
videos.description:
Adam and Matt Parker (of @standupmaths and @numberphile ) attempt another mathematical sculpture build, this time a construction of a "Borromean Box" using 81 interlinked oversized paperclips! It's a construction that neither have attempted before, and demonstrates the concept of linked Borromean rings manifest in dense interconnected cube. It's going to be quite a challenge!

Find Matt's new book, Love Triangle, here: https://amzn.to/3WWMfEZ 
Watch more of Matt's videos at Stand-Up Maths: https://www.youtube.com/user/standupmaths

videos.title: Hands-On: Meta Orion Augmented Reality Glasses!
videos.description:
We go hands-on with Orion, the augmented reality glasses prototype that Meta's Reality Labs has spent the better part of a decade developing. It’s taken years and countless millions spent to get to this point: a 98 gram pair of glasses with an optical display system that can put holograms almost everywhere your eyes can look and an input system that seemingly reads your mind. The catch: each pair costs almost $10,000 to make--the kind of moonshot device they internally call a Time Machine. Let's dive deep into how Orion’s technology works, what it’s like to use them, and what this Time Machine reveals about the future of augmented reality.

Shot by Joey Fameli and edited by Norman Chan

videos.title: Secrets of Gold-Inlaid Weapon and Armor-Making Tools! (at @metmuseum!)
videos.description:
At the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Arms and Armor conservation lab, Adam Savage is blown away by an armorer's complete collection of tools, but that's not all! Associate conservator Sean Belair explains the ancient art of damascening -- producing a design or pattern by inlaying a softer metal into a harder one -- and shows Adam some mind-blowing examples of that intricate geometric work, which would have been completed with simple tools like these. It's an emotional moment for Adam as he contemplates the tools and the work of these extraordinary makers. Do you ever contemplate the makers of artifacts in museums?

This Ancient Mace Hides a Big Surprise: https://youtu.be/mrMdYFJ0fqA
Adam Savage Meets Real Armored Gauntlets: https://youtu.be/59-9PlB-F1Y

videos.title: Adam Savage in Carbonite One Day Build!
videos.description:
Adam completes a dream build: turning himself into a life-size frozen-in-carbonite statue to hang in his workshop! Utilizing the frame of a previous Han in Carbonite build, Adam pieces together a mix of 3D printed and milled foam parts from a full body 3D scan done at FBFX. It's like putting together a life-size model kit, complete with body filling, additional sculpting, painting, and weathering to tie it all together. Hanging this display up in the workshop is no easy feat, either!

videos.title: 3D-Printing At Human Scale—Form 4L Review!
videos.description:
We test and review the new Formlabs Form 4L resin 3D printer, an industrial machine with a massive print volume that's suitable for printing objects at human scale. Here's how the Form 4L compares to its Form 3L predecessor and what the new build volume and print speeds means for rapid prototyping. Using a fast resin, printing a full-size 1:1 scale human head took only 3 hours!

videos.title: Adam Savage Meets The Original Aliens Power Loader Prop!
videos.description:
Adam Savage gets his hands on one of the most iconic movie props from the Aliens franchise: an original arm of the P-5000 Powered Work Loader (aka Power Loader) that Ripley uses to fight the Alien Queen in James Cameron's Aliens. We're astonished that this props has survived for almost 40 years and take a close look at its construction, paint job, and how it was operated on set. Plus, a rare model miniature from Aliens designed by legendary concept artist Ron Cobb!

videos.title: Adam Savage Reacts to REAL Buzz Lightyear Robot!
videos.description:
Ever since we saw the original Toy Story almost thirty years ago, we've wanted a Buzz Lightyear robot that captures the character and experience of Andy's toy seen on screen. Robosen's new Buzz Lightyear robot feels as close as we can get to a real Buzz Lightyear--fully animatronic with voice control and the ability to perform and react just as we imagined the iconic toy would if it came alive. Here's how it compares with the Lightyear animatronic--two completely different aesthetic takes on the same character!

videos.description:
Highly automated drone delivery has moved out of the realm of science fiction and is already taking place in deployment all around the world. Wing is a company that uses small aircraft to do last mile delivery of small packages–like a lunch order or urgently-needed supplies. Adam Savage visits the airfield where Wing conducts test flights to learn how these aircraft operate, how they’re tested, and what happens if a drone delivery doesn’t go according to plan. 

Learn more about Wing drone delivery at: https://www.youtube.com/@Wing
Watch The Slow Mo Guys video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5yaAFLpLmVg

Shot by Joey Fameli and Josh Self 
Edited by Joey Fameli
Music by Jinglepunks
Additional footage courtesy Wing and The Slow Mo Guys

videos.title: Chocolate 3D Printing: Hands-On with Cocoa Press 2!
videos.description:
We check out the Cocoa Press 2, a 3D printer designed to melt and 3D-print chocolate candies using the same models and printer slicer softare as traditional plastic 3D printers! Cocoa Press creator Ellie walks us through how the printer works, what kind of chocolate it uses to print, and the upgrades in this new model. Of course, we try some of the printed chocolate!

Learn more about Cocoa Press at https://cocoapress.com/

videos.title: Adam Savage Unboxes the Batmobile From Batman (1989)!
videos.description:
Adam unboxes the long-awaited 1989 Batmobile made by the 1/6 scale modelmakers and fabricators at Jazzinc Dioramas! We dive into the history and origins of this iconic vehicle, the most difficult parts to get accurate in a scaled replica, and the feat of design and engineering it took to make this collectible. At 44 inches long, it's tough to call this a miniature!

Learn more about Jazzinc Dioramas here: https://jazzincdioramas.com/ and https://www.facebook.com/JazzincDioramas/ 
Other Batman 1/6 vehicles and figures: https://jazzincdioramas.com/batman
Disclosure: This product was sent to us by the manufacturer for purposes of review.

videos.title: How Adam Savage Stores His Paints and Solvents!
videos.description:

It's the opportunity to get reacquainted with the materials and tools in an oft-neglected nook of shop, and the goal is to revamp that space in just a day and a half!

videos.title: Adam Savage Meets MacReady's Hat from The Thing!
videos.description:
Adam has obsessed over MacReady's costume from John Carpenter's The Thing, and he finally gets an audience with the original hat worn by Kurt Russell in the horrir classic. It's a chance for Adam to verify details he's meticulously researched for his own replica, and learn new things about the hat that no blu-ray screenshot would have revealed. Plus, we take a look at another piece of iconic movie headgear: David Warner's Sark helmet from the original Tron! 1982 was a great year for films!

Learn more about this prop and check out the full Propstore catalog at: https://bit.ly/propstore_tested2024

videos.title: Adam Savage Tests High-Speed Cameras with @theslowmoguys !
videos.description:

videos.title: Adam Savage's Dino Build: Building the Infrastructure (Ep 1)
videos.description:
It's back! Adam Savage has always been obsessed with building a walkaround full-size velociraptor costume. In fact, he started this costume build 4 years ago, and at long last will be finishing it with the help of a few collaborators in the workshop. But first, let's recap how Adam got to this point, speed building and experimenting with the movement mechanisms of the raptor way back in 2020. 

Shot by Adam Savage and Josh Self
Edited by Josh Self and Joey Fameli
Music by Jinglepunks

Gary Staab's TEDx Talk: Studying the dead to understand life: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8LWfb9fId_o
Learn more about Gary Staab's work at https://www.staabstudios.com/
Follow Gary Staab on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/staabstudios/
Special thanks to the team at Animax Designs for making this build possible! https://www.animaxdesigns.com/

videos.title: The Original Green Goblin Costume from Spider-Man!
videos.description:
Before the current crop of interconnected comic book films, there was the Sam Raimi Spider-Man trilogy that launched the modern era of superheroes on the big screen. And the Green Goblin from Spider-Man (2002) had one of the boldest translations of a character from comic to screen. Adam examines the actual Green Goblin hero suit, and takes a look inside its iconic helmet to investigate the electronics within!

Learn more about this costume and mask and check out the full Propstore catalog at: https://bit.ly/propstore_tested2024

videos.title: This Wood-Turned Cup Is Actually 74 Cups! (at @metmuseum)
videos.description:
During our most recent visit to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Adam Savage spent an ENTIRE DAY at the @metmuseum's Department of Objects Conservation, which is responsible for the physical care and technical study of three-dimensional works of art. And to kick off this series is this EXTRAORDINARY wooden cup filled with 73 identical cups, each turned on a lathe individually from 74 pieces of maple. What's going on here? Managing Conservation Preparator Frederick Sager explains.

More about this cup: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/856907
Met's Object Conservation Department: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/objects-conservation

videos.title: Quick Look at Sony's PlayStation 5 Pro!
videos.description:
This is the PlayStation 5 Pro, the mid-generation refresh of the now 4-year-old PS5. It’s releasing this week for $700 dollars, and we’ve been using it for the past few days, testing it out on a selection of games whose developers have patched to take advantage of the 45% faster rendering and the new PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution upscaler. Here's a quick look at the PS5 Pro hardware and some real-world performance. 

Sony PlayStation 5 Pro: https://amzn.to/3Aq29jT
Sony PlayStation 5 Slim: https://amzn.to/3YXkP2P

videos.title: Armor for Cowboys?!

videos.title: Art Preservation Hidden in Plain Sight (at @metmuseum)
videos.description:
When the Crown of the Andes -- consisting of 5 POUNDS of gold and 400+ emeralds -- arrived at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, its delicate gold arches were sagging, threatening to collapse on itself. In order to be handled and displayed safely, the priceless artifact needed a permanent but reversible mounting system that would provide support while remaining visually discrete. Luckily, conservation preparator Matthew Cumbie was up for the task, and explains to Adam Savage just how he tackled the challenge. (No pressure!)

More about this crown: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/conservation-stories/2020/crown-of-andes
Met's Object Conservation Department: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/objects-conservation

videos.title: Adam Savage Explores Wing’s Drone Engineering Workshop!
videos.description:
Autonomous drone delivery has moved out of the realm of science fiction and is already taking place in deployment all around the world. And the aircraft that make these deliveries–like the ones used by Wing–have to be designed from the ground up. We visited the Wing’s workshop and labs where they dream up new aircraft, engineer them for the task of automated delivery, and have even built a wind tunnel to test custom propellers.

videos.title: Adam Savage's Dino Build: The Great Jaw Mech Fail (Ep 3)
videos.description:
One of the first tasks to tackle in Adam's revival of his velociraptor costume build is the animatronics that make the jaw and eyes move. It's a bit of mechanical problem solving to adapt the existing neck structure to the new head sculpted by Gary Staab. And while it's not a complicated solution, the implementation of a bicycle brake-like push-pull system proves more challenging than Adam expected. 

Gary Staab's TEDx Talk: Studying the dead to understand life: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8LWfb9fId_o
Learn more about Gary Staab's work at https://www.staabstudios.com/
Follow Gary Staab on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/staabstudios/

videos.title: How Costumes and Props Are Weathered for Filming!
videos.description:
After the props and costumes for a show like SILO are fabricated, they pass through the production's paint department where artists paint and distress them to make them look lived-in and consistent among the many versions that may appear on screen. Adam visits this department to chat with Senior Breakdown Artist Elsa Wood-Gee and learn her favorite tools and techniques for weathering!

SILO season 2 is now streaming on Apple TV+.

videos.title: XREAL One + One Pro Hands-On Impressions!
videos.description:
Something has changed within these. We go hands-on with XREAL's newly announced One and One Pro smart glasses that put a large spatial display in front of you while connected to your phone, laptop, or game console. The integration of a custom X1 processor now allows built-in 3DOF tracking, a feature we've long waited for with XREAL's products. But the bigger deal may be the optics on the higher-end Pro model. Let's dive in!

XREAL One: https://amzn.to/3ZCLfZ1
Learn more about these glasses at http://www.xreal.com
Note: Hands-on was conducted on pre-consumer release hardware and software, which may reflect a different experience from the latest consumer release.

videos.title: Could the Wright Flyer Work as an RC Airplane?
videos.description:
Adam welcomes Wing CEO Adam Woodworth into the cave to take a look at a selection of his personal RC plane projects, including several novel builds that push the limits of traditional model aircraft design!

Learn more about Wing drone delivery at: https://www.youtube.com/@Wing
Testing the Limits of Delivery Drones: https://youtu.be/YhNfeejuByI
Adam Savage Explores Wing’s Drone Engineering Workshop!: https://youtu.be/_BXm6dTHvY0

Want to get more involved in the RC hobby? Here are some helpful resources recommended by Adam Woodworth:

Academy of Model Aeronautics (AMA): https://www.modelaircraft.org/
The AMA is the leading organization for model aviation enthusiasts in the U.S., dedicated to safety, education, and advocacy. They provide insurance coverage for members, organize competitions, and advocate for model aviation interests with government agencies.

Flite Test: https://www.flitetest.com/
This website is a fantastic resource for RC airplane and drone enthusiasts of all skill levels. They offer build plans, product reviews, tutorials, and a supportive online community.

RCGroups: https://www.rcgroups.com/
This is one of the largest online forums dedicated to radio-controlled hobbies, including airplanes, drones, cars, and boats. It's an excellent place to find information, ask questions, and connect with other RC enthusiasts.

videos.title: Adam Savage Stunned by These Paintings-Turned-Sculptures!
videos.description:
Adam visits the workshop of prop designer and fabricator Pierre Bohanna who, among many other things, was responsible for making hero costumes and props for films like The Dark Knight, Edge of Tomorrow, and the Harry Potter Series. But outside his work for the film industry, Pierre's Bohanna Art studio has taken on the challenge of turning iconic paintings like Rousseau's "Tiger in a Tropical Storm" and van Gogh's "Sunflowers" into unique 3D sculptures, each more mind-blowing than the next. 

Learn more about Pierre Bohanna's bespoke art pieces at https://www.bohannaart.com/

videos.title: Adam Savage Levels Up His Workshop 3D Printer!
videos.description:
Adam kicks off the new year with a massive 3D printer upgrade to his workshop! After diving deep into FDM printing and integrating SLA printing into his builds, he's finally trying his hand at SLS (Selective Laser Sintering) Nylon printing using the Formlabs Fuse. Getting this new system set up in the cave and calibrated is the first step, and then Adam and Norm try their hands first prints to examine the unique qualities of sintered nylon. What would you like to see Adam test with this new printer?

Learn more about the Formlabs Fuse SLS 3D printer: https://formlabs.com/3d-printers/fuse-1/

videos.title: What Museums Don’t Want You to Notice (at @metmuseum)
videos.description:
Have you ever thought about museum mounts? Likely not, and that's deliberate. In the case of this centuries-old vanity box, @metmuseum's curators, designers and mount makers worked together to make sure no ugly brace was reflected its mirror as admirers crane their necks to admire the piece, distracting from the aesthetics.  Warren Bennett -- conservation preparator at Met Metropolitan Museum of Art's Department of Objects Conservation -- takes Adam Savage through the painstaking mount-making process he pursued so visitors can appreciate the art without interruption while still protecting the artifact.

More about this artifact: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/681122
Met's Object Conservation Department: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/objects-conservation

videos.title: Engineering “Floating” Mounts at @metmuseum!
videos.description:
Small objects such as jewelry can be challenging for museums to display. It's not compelling to lie them down in a case; curators want as close to a 360-degree view as possible, and the items might also need to shown open or as if they were being worn. But NO one wants the mount to distract from the craftsmanship of the artifact, or to interfere with its preservation. Here are three examples of historic pieces of jewelry -- a watch from 1670, a bracelet from the 18th or 19th century,  and a 17th century pocket watch -- and their very unique mounts, as presented to Adam Savage by @metmuseum conservation preparators Jacob Goble, Warren Bennett and Laila Lott. 

More about the watch: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/194113
More about the hathphul: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/450394
More about the pocket watch: https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/194007

videos.title: What Adam Savage Has Learned About 3D Printing Nylon!

videos.title: Adam Savage Experiences Serious Tool Envy at @metmuseum
videos.description:
Tested viewers and cave visitors often "complain" that Adam Savage costs them a lot of money via exposure to his extensive tool collection. But the tables were turned during a recent visit to the @metmuseum's Object Conservation Department, where conservation preparator Matthew Cumbie took Adam on a tour of the surprising and sometimes obscure tools he and his team use in their work. Which tools are you putting on YOUR shopping list now?

videos.title: How the @metmuseum Mounts, Restores and Conserves Its Objects
videos.description:
While Tested has had the honor of filming at @metmuseum before, this was our first time in their object conservation department, which is responsible for the preservation and treatment of all three-dimensional art (outside of arms and armor), from the earliest antiquity to the latest commission. What are the challenges of such an a high-stakes charge? Adam Savage chats with Lisa Pilosi, Sherman Fairchild Conservator in Charge of Objects Conservation, about how the Met approaches mounting, preserving and conserving their collection.

videos.title: Adam Savage Builds a T-Rex Stop-Motion Armature!
videos.description:
Adam has long admired effects artist Phil Tippett's mastery of creature movement and the way he animated his stop-motion puppets, including the ones Phil made for Jurassic Park that never made it to film. To pay tribute to Phil's work, Adam begins a replica of the T-Rex puppet that sits in Tippett Studio's lobby, starting with a printed 3D scan of the head and manually machining all the joints and clevis hinges that make up its neck.

videos.title: Weathering FAIL: Rock Tumbler Meets Lighter (From Constantine)
videos.description:
One of Adam's favorite prop replicas is this lighter from the 2005 comic book adaptation of Constantine. Not only is it a beautifully made prop, but it's the kind of object that visually wears over time with handling and use. To acclerate its natural wear, Adam tries aging it in a rock tumbler filled with a drawer full of old keys--the idea of making it look like it's been living in someone's pocket for years.

videos.title: How The Original Ghostbusters Ghost Trap Worked!
videos.description:
Adam encounters one of the actual ghost trap props used on screen for Ghostbusters I and II, and this is a special one. Connected to the original transmitter controller used on set, this ghost trap is packed full of practical effects that not only let it open and close, but activate all the flashing and blinking lights that we saw in the films. videos.title: [ASL/ACCESSIBILITY ENABLED] Adam Savage’s Ingenious Fractal Vise Mod!
videos.description:
NOTE: THIS IS NOT THE ONLY VERSION OF THE VIDEO! Non-ASL cut is here: https://youtu.be/5Vjw6c3BDPU

YOUR FEEDBACK IS WANTED. These ASL videos are an experiment. What do you think? What videos would you like to see us create ASL versions for?
ASL composite, closed captioning and descriptive audio track provided by the Described and Captioned Media Program (DCMP); learn more at https://dcmp.org

Adam tunes and modifies his fractal vise to improve its already impressive gripping powers! If you've ever wondered how these marvels of clamping worked, today is the perfect day to find out as Adam has to fully disassemble this vise to smooth out the movements of its individual semi-circles. But Adam goes further in adding even more granular teeth to those half moons, making it possible for the vise to comfortably grab ahold of a glass soda bottle!

Adam unboxing this fractal vise: https://youtu.be/NUhrF0xkhhc
Original non-ASL version: https://youtu.be/5Vjw6c3BDPU
Fractal vise: https://www.alibaba.com/product-detail/Fractal-Vise_1600318578412.html

videos.title: Adam Savage Builds an Artificial Heart Replica!
videos.description:
One of Adam's lesser-known obsessions is the Jarvik-7, the first artificial heart successfully implanted in a patient in 1982. This elegantly engineered device is beautiful in its delicate operation and aesthetic design, and Adam has been working with propmaker Bill Doran in making his own 3D-printed replica. Making use of our resin and SLS printers, Adam builds his interpretation of the Jarvik-7 and shares the files for anyone to print their own!

Find the 3D model for this Jarvik-7 artificial heart replica here: https://www.printables.com/model/1258871-jarvik-7-artificial-heart-nonfunctional-model

videos.title: Adam Savage Examines This Steampunk GPS System!
videos.description:
Adam is floored by the RadioScout, a whimsical handheld GPS navigation system created by the propmakers at Hardly Human FX. Using an rotary dial to lay in target coordinates, this steampunk-style device not only has a lovely antique aesthetic but also has a tactility that feels great in hand to use. Thanks so much to Jace and Vic for delivering it!
